paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Mutations in three genes are responsible for the vast majority of LQTS cases in humans, namely KCNQ1 encoding Kv7.1 channel α-subunit (LQT1, 35% of cases), KCNH2 encoding Kv11.1 channel α-subunit (LQT2, 30% of cases), and SCN5A encoding Nav1.5 Na+ channel α-subunit (LQT3, 10% of cases).

functional_data.summary: KCNH2 mutations lead to loss-of-function K+ channel activity, reducing repolarizing K+ currents and causing AP prolongation.

key_quotes: Mutations in three genes are responsible for the vast majority of LQTS cases in humans, namely KCNQ1 encoding Kv7.1 channel α-subunit (LQT1, 35% of cases), KCNH2 encoding Kv11.1 channel α-subunit (LQT2, 30% of cases), and SCN5A encoding Nav1.5 Na+ channel α-subunit (LQT3, 10% of cases).

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant related to KCNH2 was found, with no specific cDNA or protein notation provided.
